name: Serendipity Bread
author: Sue Litster
summary: A flatbread that starts in the bread machine and ends up on an outdoor grill. My sister 'discovered' this bread when she had a batch of bread dough rising in her bread machine when the power went off for the whole day. Incredible.
directions: Place the first set of ingredients into the pan of the bread machine in the order recommended by the manufacturer
Do not put in the olive oil, garlic powder or feta cheese
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat
When the cycle has ended, turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface, and divide into 2 halves
Roll each half out into a circle that is about 9 or 10 inches across
Brush the top of each circle with olive oil
Place the bread circles oil side down onto the grill
Brush the other side with olive oil, and watch carefully
When the bottom side is browned, turn over the bread, and grill the other side until golden
If desired, sprinkle with garlic powder and feta cheese
